thread.title: Michael Caine discusses his lead role in "Youth"
thread.title_full: Michael Caine discusses his lead role in "Youth"

title: Michael Caine discusses his lead role in "Youth"
text:
Michael Caine discusses his lead role in "Youth" 2:39am IST - 01:30 
The stars of ''Youth,'' mostly veteran thespians such as Michael Caine and Harvey Keitel, hit the red carpet at its premiere at London Film Festival. Elly Park reports.   
Veteran actors Michael Caine and and Harvey Keitel star as two longtime friends in the dramatic comedy "Youth". Set in a luxurious spa in the Swiss alps, Caine is in the role of a retired British orchestra conductor refusing to conduct one final concert before the Queen, while Keitel plays a famous screenwriter finishing up his script. At the film's premiere in London, Caine praised director Paolo Sorrentino who wrote the part for the 82-year-old actor. SOUNDBITE: Actor Michael Caine, saying (English) "I was amazed you know, and the most amazing thing about it was, it was called 'Youth', and I'm starring in it I thought well, when I read the script I realized, no but it's one of the best scripts I'd had you know and I usually don't play leading parts in movies any more, because I'm too lazy, but this one I had to do it.." Actress Rachel Weisz plays Lena, Caine's emotionally fragile daughter. SOUNDBITE: Actress Rachel Weisz, saying (English) "I mean, Michael Caine, Harvey Keitel, Jane Fonda, they're all living legends and they were living legends playing living legends. So I think Paulo the director is playing with the idea of their iconography so it was a lot of fun." The film is based on a true story and is the second English-language feature by Oscar winning director Sorrentino. "Youth" opens in theaters on December 4th.  //reut.rs/1MuuvTW
